title: Consensus-Oriented Peer Discussion Teaching Method Design for Lower-Elementary Grades

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science concepts and online learning platform usage experience
context.additional_context: Pre-service elementary teachers learn explicit instructional design strategies to effectively guide students in scientific discussion classes. Overcoming time/space constraints through microlearning content accessible via smartphones.

learning_goals: Students can explain and apply a 4-step discussion facilitation strategy for reaching consensus in scientific debate situations
Students can generate three or more open-ended questions that explore and develop diverse perspectives during peer discussions
By analyzing actual elementary classroom cases, students can identify three factors that hinder consensus-oriented discussions and propose improvement measures

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
